greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The "rootless" zeta function. Dirichlet inverse of the function defined by r(n) = (-1)^Omega(n) if n is 1 or not a perfect power and r(n) = 0 otherwise.
comment: Omega(n) = A001222(n) is the number of prime factors of n counted with multiplicity.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(1) = 1 and a(n > 1) = -Sum_{d|n, d not a perfect power} (-1)^Omega(d) * a(n/d).
xref: Positions of entries greater than 1 appear to be A126706.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 18 2018
